title: Saudi Crown Prince Tours Gulf as Iran Nuclear Talks Stall
sub_head: Mohammed bin Salman aims to build consensus against Tehran in first regional tour since the pandemic
body:
DUBAI—Saudi Arabia’s Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman embarked on a rare tour of the Persian Gulf region in a bid to shore up his position with neighboring allies and build consensus on the threat posed by rival Iran as world powers hold talks to revive the 2015 nuclear deal.
As he arrived in Oman on Monday for talks with the country’s ruler, Saudi air defenses intercepted ballistic missiles above Riyadh and a southern border city. The Defense Ministry blamed Iran-aligned Houthi rebels in Yemen and said shrapnel had fallen on some residential districts in the capital without causing damage.
